metadata.synopsis: Relationships with a woman (Dana Vavrova) and an adoring friend (Ben Becker) overwhelm a 19th-century Austrian peasant (Andre Eisermann), a musical genius.

reviews: The film's real pleasure isn't its humor so much as its overall excess, the tone it projects of several major chords being struck at once.
It's Wagnerian without reaching any romantic intimacy or the mythology of the Ring Cycle.
Visually stunning and dramatically absorbing portrait of a tormented musical genius.
